title.native: プラスティックメモリーズ

description:
This story takes place in a future not too far away when androids that look exactly like humans begin to spread across the world. The android production company SA Corp. produced Giftia, a new kind of android that has the most amount of emotion and human-like qualities out of any other model ever seen. However, due to problems in technology, the androids have a service life, and once they pass that, they... Well, it gets pretty bad. For this reason, SA Corp. creates a terminal service in order to retrieve Giftia that have gone past their service life. A new employee at the terminal service named Tsukasa Mizugaki forms a team with the Giftia Isla to retrieve the other androids, but...

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/林直孝_(脚本家%29)

A scriptwriter and game scenario writer.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator/director](https://anilist.co/staff/110663/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/林直孝_(脚本家%29)

A scriptwriter and game scenario writer.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator/director](https://anilist.co/staff/110663/)._

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

__[Website](https://erisasaki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eri_lattice)__

__Eri Sasaki__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer, who is signed to 5pb. Records and Sony Music Publishing. She made her music debut in 2015 with the release of her first single "Ring of Fortune", which is used as the opening theme to the anime television series Plastic Memories. She released her first album in 2017.

(Source: [Eri Sasaki's Official Website](https://erisasaki.net/profile), edited)

[Website](http://5pb.jp/records/sp/asami/index.html) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/ubiquitous777/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/asamingosu)

Debuted as a voice actress in 1999 and as singer in 2009 by releasing her first single "Day by Day / Shining Blue Rain" under the 5pb. Records label. Currently working with Eri Kitamura in the music unit ARTERY VEIN.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- Drake - Azur Lane (VG)
- Levia - Trillion: God of Destruction (VG)
- Noire / Black Heart - Hyperdimension Neptunia
- Otohana Sumire - Blue Archive
Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/Doga-Kobo). Sparsely worked as a production assistant earlier in her career.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nara_kappa) | [Alt Twitter](https://twitter.com/narak0999)

Freelance Japanese animator and director. After debuting in 2012, he joined [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) in 2014. In 2020 he became a freelancer and would make his directorial debut on episode 6 of [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/WONDER-EGG-PRIORITY). 

Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/104990/), who isn't an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nara_kappa) | [Alt Twitter](https://twitter.com/narak0999)

Freelance Japanese animator and director. After debuting in 2012, he joined [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) in 2014. In 2020 he became a freelancer and would make his directorial debut on episode 6 of [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/WONDER-EGG-PRIORITY). 

Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/104990/), who isn't an animator.
